---
title: Git resources for learning
---

[Git cheat sheet](https://education.github.com/git-cheat-sheet-education.pdf): Always handy if you don't remember the basic commands

## Learning git

Blogpost: [Learn git concepts, not commands](https://dev.to/unseenwizzard/learn-git-concepts-not-commands-4gjc): Explains really well the concepts of git, also more advanced ones like `rebase` or `cherry-pick`.


Blogpost: [How to write good commit messages](https://cbea.ms/git-commit/): Explains why good commit messages are important and gives 7 rules for writing them.

[Git book](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2): Explains git concepts from the very beginning.

## Git with R

Book [Happy git with R](https://happygitwithr.com/): Great book to get started with git and R

[Download Github Desktop](https://desktop.github.com/)
